poem:
Strictly Come Dancing Refrain

Fringed cowboys shimmy,
ranch night's neon glows—
Toyah turns, but Tom
tumbles, poised in flight,
eyeing steps unseen.

Tonight, under lights,
dreams flicker footfall's grace
and fall like autumn leaves—
whisper, tomorrow
is another dance.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Strictly Come Dancing: first results show – as it happened 8.33pm BST "Befringed cowpersons channelling Village People at the Chicken Ranch" Before I sign off, one last reader email just in. Based on what I hoped to see from both of them in coming weeks, I expected to enjoy watching Tom’s progress as a dancer more than whatever routines Toyah". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
